pelagian tenent foraſmuch maintained god foreſaw thing faith therefore god elected u foundation world ſhould holy unblameable love theſe word no autem dicimus nostram deum non praeſciſſe niſi fidem ideo no elegiſſe—ut etiam ſancti immaculati gratia atquè opere ejus eſſemus courſe doth auſtin take beat namely prove like holines ſo faith alſo touching initiation thereof work god thus sed audiant voluntates quocunquè voluerit ſive ad bona pro ſuâ miſericordiâ ſive ad mala pro meritis eorum judicio uti que ſuo aliquando aperto aliquando occulto ſemper autem justo de grat lib arbitr cap 21 touching particular caſe shimei inquiring interpretation ſee pray reſolves concerning quomodo dixerit dominus huic homini maledicere david quis ſapiens intelliget non enim jubendo dixit ubi obedientia laudaretur ſed quod ejus voluntatem proprio vitio ſuo malam hoc peccatum judicio ſuo juſto occulto inclinavit ideò dictum eſt dixit ei dominus nam ſi jubenti obtemper aſſet deo laudandus potius quam puniendus eſſet ſicut ex hoc peccato poſteà novimus eſſe punitum proceeds farther ſhew reaſon divine providence nec cauſa tacita eſt cur ei deus juſto modo dixerit maledicere david hoc eſt de grat lib arbit cap 20 cor ejus malum hoc peccatum miſerit vel dimiſerit ut videat inquit dominus humilitatem meam retribuat mihi bona pro maledictio ejus die iſto hereupon concludes ecce quomodo probatur deum uti cordibus etiam malorum ad laudem que adjumentum bonorum sic uſus eſt iuda tradente chriſtum sic uſus eſt iudaeis crucifigentibus chriſtum quantum inde bona praeſtitit populis credituris qui ipſo utitur diabolo peſſimo ſed optimè ad excercendam probandam fidem pietatem bonorum non ſibi quia omnia ſcit antequam fiant ſed nobis quibus erat neceſſarium ut eo modo ageretur nobiſcum let u proceed ſapiens intelligit god bid man curſe david wiſe ſhall understand non enim jubendo dixit ubi obedientia laudaretur ſed quod ejus voluntatem proprio vitio ſuo malum hoc peccatum judicio ſuo juſto neceſſariò eveniunt ſed unumquod que ſuo naturae modo neither zeno conceive hereby place taken away perſwaſion appears anſwer crate took cloake draw away stilpo ſaying crate commodiſſimè auribus philoſophum teneas cum igitur perſuaſeris tum illum trahe nam ſi per vim egeris corpus quidem apud te ſed animus apud stilponem erit neither philoſophers ſtudious morality stoicks wrote de bonis mali de affectibus de virtute de fine de que primâ aeſtimatione de actibus ac de officiis de adhortationibus dehortationibus diogenes writes life zeno auſtin de civit dei cap 9 profeſſeth stoicks though omnia fato fieri contenderent yet non omnia neceſſitate fieri dicerent whereas stoicks ſo jealous maintaining liberty men will denyed thing ſubject neceſſity auſtin profeſſeth feare ſubjecting will men unto neceſſity reſpect cauſeleſſe feare ibid cap 10 unde nec illa neceſſitas formidanda eſt quam formidando stoici laboraverunt cauſas rerum ita diſtinguere ut quaſdam ſubtraherent neceſſitati quaſdam ſubderent que quas eſſe ſub neceſſitate noluerunt poſuerunt etiam noſtras voluntates ne videlicet non eſſent liberae ſi ſubderentur neceſſitati proceeds ſhew certain neceſſity nothing prejudiciall albeit acknowledged ſubjection thereunto neceſſity deſcribes ſay neceſſe eſt ut ita ſit aliquid vel ita fiat word theſe si autem illa definitur eſſe neceſsitas ſecundum quam dicimus neceſſe eſt ut ita ſit aliquid vel ita fiat neſcio cur eam timemus ne nobis libertatem auferat voluntatis herein auſtin profeſſeth goe beyond stoicks acknowledging neceſſity whereunto man ſubject without detriment liberty thereof yet judgement would better become chriſtian divine informe himſelfe others word god reſt thereon diſcovery nature providence predeſtination divine goe forraging among unavoidable god abſolute decree theſe two thing maximum gravamina ſide ſtick theſe two path meet laſt ſame way becauſe laſt choſen moſt lateſt maintainer abſolute decree moderate two eaſyer defended ſet concluſion diſlike way word god hath abſolutely purpoſed eternity meer pleaſure without conſideration actuall continuance ſinne unbeliefe utterly caſt grace glory million men conſidered fall even thoſe call repentance ſolvation preaching goſpell manifeſtation ſeverity juſtice mankind involved firſt ſinne fruit thereof corruption nature guilt eternall death confidently believe god abſolutely intend leave men woefull ſtate ever upon ſinne build peremptory decree unavoidable damnation farre greater part mankind cannot yet perſwaded thus plainly laid poſition deem falſe come next place deliver reaſons againſt two ſorts 1 firſt made queſtion truth 2 doe preſent convince cannot truth twisse conſideration break main reaſon moved author repreſent different opinion divine object predeſtination ſo way might opened unto pleaſure charge former opinion thought good proofe criminations might better eaſe himſelfe burthen thereof ſhewing diſſent devines ſame profeſſion former particular making choyce rather ſhape object predeſtination reprobation notion mankind lying maſſe corrupt fall adam ſurely preſuppoſed diſſent former friend without ſome reaſon author make bold inſinuate theſe abſurdities mentioned reaſons ſaith theſe abſurdities following evidently upper way others ſame ſide willing decline rock precipice doe leave way theſe motif whereby induced decline decree predeſtination reprobation ſecret neither doe appeare condition manner execution execution doe conſiſt partly beſtowing ſalvation ſome inflicting damnation others partly beſtowing grace faith repentance ſome denying unto others touching ſalvation damnation willingly profeſſe ſalvation men ripe year doth alwaies preſuppoſe faith perſeverance therein damnation others doth alwaies preſuppoſe finall perſeverance ſinne unrepented deny herehence followeth either faith precedes decree ſalvation ſinne precedes decree damnation preſcience either faith cannot precede election ſinne reprobation evident much election reprobation eternall faith ſinne thing temporall wich temporall cannot precede eternall neither doth follow becauſe faith precedes ſalvation therefore faith precedes decree ſalvation faith exiſtent time precedes ſalvation divine ſay faith exiſtent time precedes god decree ſalvation unleſſe ſome ſuch maintaine vorſtius god decree eternall like ſort ſinne exiſtent time precedes damnation wiſe divine ſay ſinne exiſtent time precedes god decree damnation former thing temporall decree eternall laſtly neither follow becauſe faith precedes ſalvation ſinne damnation therefore foreſight faith antecedanious decree ſalvation foreſight ſinne antecedent decree damnation enthymeme nature ſound ſo farre forth reducible good categorical syllogiſme whereof theſe enthymems uncapable enthymems reducible unto good syllogiſmes muſt agree either subject predicate theſe doe termes good enthymeme muſt expreſſed syllogiſme whereunto reduced▪ theſe enthymemes conſiſteth manifeſtly four termes firſt • e faith foreſight faith salvation decree ſalvation ſecond theſe sinne foreſight ſinne damnation decree damnation conſequently syllogiſme whereunto either theſe quaternary termes clapd cannot good categoricall syllogiſme good conſiſteth foure termes reducing syllogiſme hypotheticall ſuch reduction never heard schooles learned juſt reaſon becauſe courſe juſtify ſoundneſſe enthymemes meer begging queſtion caſe man ſhould reduce thus faith precedanious ſalvation foreſight faith precedanious decree ſalvation faith precedanious ſalvation therefore precedanious decree ſalvation hypotheticall syllogiſme conſequence major enthymeme queſtion ſubſtance conſequently proving meere begging yet notwithſtanding doe deny god decree man ſhould ſaved ſuch ripe year ſhould found perſevere faith unto death none ſhould damned ſuch ſhould found finally perſevere ſinne execution theſe decree conſiſts ſaid beſtowing grace faith repentance ſome denying unto others queſtion whether god indeed author faith repentance yea becauſe arminian dare profeſſedly deny though lately come ſo farre profeſſedly deny chriſt merited therefore let queſtion proceede manner god beſtowes namely whether beſtowes meer pleaſure ſome denying others whether reaſon god beſtowes ſome others becauſe god findes ſome good work one findes another queſtion decided clearly appeare whether predeſtination proceeds upon foreſight ought man yea god meer pleaſure doth beſtow faith one another followes undeniably god predeſtinated hereunto abſolutely meer pleaſure without conſideration future work man god beſtowes faith man upon conſideration ſome precedent work work god otherwiſe neither follow upon conſideration future work man god elect unto faith predeſtinate faith apolog 2 adv ruffin writer arrian hereſy aroſe competent judge poynt si cauſas vitiorum ſaith patrum scriptis neſcire reſpondero non ſtatim illos haereticos judicabo fieri enim poteſt ut vel ſimpliciter erraverint vel alio ſenſu ſcripſerint vel librariis imperitis eorum paulatim ſcripta corrupta ſunt vel certè antequam alexandriâ quaſi daemonium meridianum arrius naſceretur innocenter quaedam minus cautè locuti ſunt quae non poſſunt perverſorum hominum calumniam declinare marke well arrius like devill south roſe father delivered ſome thing innocently yet leſe warily ſuch cannot avoid calumny perverſe perſons upon ſame ground auſtin excuſeth ticonius aug de doctr chriſt l 3 c 33 ſame particular wherein approached neere pelagianiſme wit church god acquainted hereſy word theſe sed non erat expertus hanc haereſin ticonius quae noſtro tempore exorta multum no ut gratia dei quae per dominum nostrum jeſum chriſtum eſt adverſus eos defenderemus exercuit ſecundum id quod ait apoſtolus oportet haereſes eſſe ut probati manifesti fiant vobis multò vigilantiores diligentioreſ que reddidit ut advérteremus ſcripturis sanctis quod iſtum ticonium minús attentum minuſ que ſine hoſte ſollicitum fugit etiam ipſam ſcilicet fidem donum illius eſe qui ejus menſuram unicui que partitur ticonius conſidered faith ſelfe gift god neither ſo carefull look truth ſurely becauſe enemy put acquainted errour pelagius hereſy ſaith ariſing day hath put u upon defence grace god given u lord jeſus chriſt hath made u watchfull diligent obſerve even faith ſelfe gift diſtributes every one hereof conſidering living hereſy known wit pelagius put upon diſcuſſing queſtion ſurely would done conſtrained aug de praed ſanct l 1 cap 14 make anſwer ſuch pelagians see word si hujus ſententiae defenſionem ex divinorum eloquiorum no praecedentibus catholicis tractatoribus promerem profectò hi fratres quibuſcum no agimus acquieſcerent hoc enim ſignificaſtis literis veſtris proſpers motion mark auſtins anſwer quid igitur opus eſt ut eorum ſcrutemur opuſcula qui priuſquam iſta haereſis oriretur non habueruni neceſſitatem hac difficili ad ſolvendum quaeſtione verſari quod proculdubio facerent ſi reſpondere talibus cogerentur charity ſuggeſt unto would courſe exerciſed pelagius caſe time himſelfe thought albeit holineſſe good work conſequent faith together ſalvation work god yet faith ſelfe conceived work man wit exerciſed pelagius appears liber propoſitionum ex epiſtolâ romanos non ergo elegit deus opera cujus que praeſcientiâ ſed fidem elegit praeſcientiâ vel quem ſibi crediturum eſſe praeſcivit ipſum elegit cui spiritum sanctum daret ut bona operando eriam vitam aeternam conſequeretur profeſſeth word following conceived noſtrum eſſe credere believe work afterwards retracteth retract lib 1 cap 25 profeſſing never ſaid known faith ſelfe gift god si ſciviſſem fidem ipſam inter dei munera quae dantur per spiritum sanctum reperiri nam quamvis credere operari utrum que noſtrum ſit propter liberum voluntatis arbitrium quae non niſi volentibus nobis fiunt utrum que dei donum eſt qui credere velle perficere ſubminiſtrat papiſts themſelves notwithſtanding great devotion pretend towards ancient yet driven deviſe may ſaid excuſe point freewill deſire excuſe chryſoſtome sixtus senenſis biblioth •• lib 5 annotat 101 uel dicendum est ſicut etiam annianus praedestinantis aquinas profeſſeth againſt thing impoſſible namely ſhould cauſe god quoad actum volentis nay bold ſay man ſo mad ſay merit cauſe predeſtination quoad actum praedeſtinantis laſt part illum qui periit non accepiſſe ut ſalvus eſſe poſſit anathema illi qui dixerit quod va contumcliae non poſſit affurgere ut ſit va honorem firſt anſwer touching anathema themſelves touching credit authority ſtory 1 touching anathema firſt proceeds well baptized afterwards periſheth pagan never baptized periſheth paganiſme anathema ſelfe witneſſeth repeated full thus anathema illi qui dixerit illum qui periit non accepiſſe ut ſalvus eſſe poſſit id eſt vel de baptizato vel de illius aetatis pagano qui credere potuit noluit latter clauſe appears accipere ut ſalvus eſſe poſſit receive poſsibilitatem credendi ſay poſſibilitatem potentiam becauſe find faustus uſuall phraiſe phraiſe pelagius much ſay every man hath power believe obſerve pray kind power meerely nature commonly call grace whereby underſtand ſomething diſtinct nature auſtin acknowledgeth de gen contr manichae lib 1 cap 3 men poſſunt credere ſi velint ſignified naturall illumination wherewith god enlightens every man come world iohn 1 9 de praedeſt sanct cap 5 poſſe habere fidem ſicut poſſe habere charitatem naturae eſt hominum fidem verò habere ſicut charitatem habere gratiae eſt fidelium ſtate queſtion pelagius catholiques thoſe day ſo propoſed auſtin conſiſt poſſibility believing good work meerly willing ſo much auſtin profeſſeth pelagius would acknowledge good god poſſibility hereof god ſhould end controverſy pelagius ſhould received good catholique appears book de gratiâ chriſti contra pelagium caeleſtium cap 6 pelagius word theſe ſpeaking god qui ipſius voluntatis operis poſſibilitatem dedit hanc autem poſſibilitatem ſaith auſtin naturâ eum ponere de verbis ejus ſuperioribus clarum eſt sed ne nihil de gratiâ dixiſſe videretur adjunxit qui que ipſam ipſam voluntatem gratiae ſuae adjuvat ſemper auxilio adjutorium poſſibilitatis ſence delivered auſtin profeſſeth obſcure touching nature touching manner conceived nature man aided thereby place ſaith ſpeaks plainly appears conſiſt giving law affording inſtruction way mark auſtins obſervation upon theſe word pelagius qui que ipſam poſsibilitatem gratiae ſuae adjuvat ſemper auxilio non ait ſaith auſtin ipſam voluntatem vel ipſam operationem quod ſi diceret non abhorrere à doctrinâ catholicâ videretur voluntatem adjuvari auſtins meaning voluntatem praeparari à domino ut velit operationem adjuvari voluntatem corroborari ne fruſtrà velit one operation call grace prevenient ſubſequent according nolentem praevenit ut velit volentem ſubſequitur ne fruſtrà velit cap 25 ſame book non ſolum deus poſſe nostrum donavit que adjuvat ſed etiam velle operari operatur nobis whereby appears voluntatem que operationem noſtram adjuvari à deo deum operari nobis velle operari quod bonum eſt pelagius acknowledged received catholique excepted againſt acknowledging poſsibilitatem volendi que agendi quod bonum eſt touching ſecond anathema ſay va contumeliae may taken double ſenſe either ſignify veſſel deſerving contumely deſerving wrath ſignify veſſell ordained contumely ſuffering eternall wrath firſt ſenſe queſtion man may change veſſell contumely veſſell wrath condition veſſell honour ſecond ſenſe impoſſible ſhould arles 1 ſay ſuppoſe truth yet yeare 494 roman councell wherein gelaſius 70 biſhops juſtify writing auſtin proſper condemne writing caſſian fauſtus whoſe procurement pretended biſhops arles ſubſcribed epiſtle fauſtus unto lucidus father pretended councell arles reckoned ſixteen 2 credit ſtory lyeth wholly upon fauſtus relation honeſty therein man infamous church oppoſing auſtin doctrine grace predeſtination appears writing fulgentius petrus diaconus alchimus avitus others ado viennenſis chron ad ann 492 writes thus fauſtus ex abbate monaſterii licinenſis apud regem galliae epiſcopus facius pelagianorum dogma deſtruere conatus yet may made apparent meerly pretence errorem unde qui ejus ſenſus hac parte catholicos praedicant ſicut germadius de viris illuſtribus ſcribens omninò errant ita enim liberum arbitrium tàm auguſtinus quam caeteri catholici eccleſia dei docent ut illuminatio virtu ſalus illi à chriſto per chriſtum chriſto ſit fauſtus verò iſte ita liberum chriſtianorum arbitrium docere conatur ut illuminatio virtu ſalus non à chriſto ſed naturâ ſit contra hunc ſcribit beatiſſimus avitus viennenſis epiſcopus lucidiſſima fide ejus redarguens errorem ſimiliter joannes vir eruditiſſimus antiochenus presbyter iſidore book de viris illuſtribus teſtifies fulgentius wrote ſeven book againſt fauſtus qui mirâ calliditate catholicus videri volebat cum pelagianus eſſet auctor quo que vitae 5ti fulgentii teſtatur à sancto fulgentio refutatos libros duo fauſti de grat liber arbitrio petrus diaconus book de incarnatione gratiâ chriſti cap ultim anathema dicit libris unto apparent oſianders hiſtory conferre thereof true ſtood firſt gave reaſons length fellowes condeſcended inſtance importunity adverſaries ſo came conference hereabout word theſe praefat 2 part reſponſ ad acta colloq mompelg quamvis quò evaſura eſſent reliqua ſatis proſpiceremus mane nihilominus mutata ſententia illuſtriſſ principe ſalutato reliquam ſequentem collationem conſenſimus eâ tantùm conditione additâ ne propter proximum paſchae feſtum ea diſceptatio longius protraheretur et ita demùm ad audiendas andreae declamationes rurſum proceſſimus point alone ſifting whereof author phraſeth beza declined apparent leſſe three point appears ſecond part bezas anſwer ad act colloq mompelg alſo anſwer jacobus andreae mouth prince namely liſt de tribus illis conferre yet thought fit theſes written thoſe three article ſhould rehearſed hearing afterwards beza fellowes might take home addreſſe anſwer afterwards thought good theſe three article concerning predeſtination baptiſme putting image church concerning jacobus andreae give reaſons thought fit ſhould entertaine farther conference whereunto beza make anſwer praeface ſecond part anſwer ad act colloq mompelg true reaſon beza gave thought fit place publiquely diſpute thereof wit predeſtination quod haec graviſſima quaestio publicè illo caetu allatis utrin que contrariis ſententiis diſceptari abſ que nonnullorum queſtiones ad quas paſtoribus à claſſibus deputatis reſponderi volebant quae cum ad controverſiae de primo articulo ſtatum non ſpectarent etiam mutilae que intricatae plerae que eſſent eum que finem ab illis proponerentur ut hoc modo praecipuo controverſiae statu rectum que agendi ratione ambage ad ducerent paſtores expoſitâ per libellum ſupplicem illuſt ordd iniquâ hâc agendi ratione non quidem deprecati ſunt ne de reprobatione ſententiam ſuam manifestarent uti remonſtrantes improbè ſaepius ipſis objectarunt ſed diſertè ſententiam ſuam quantum ad eccleſiarum pacem que aedificationem ſufficere exiſtimarent non tantum vivâ voce ſed ſcripto declararunt se nimirum cum aeternum electionis ſingularium perſonarum decretum ponunt ſimul quo que ponere aeternum de reprobatione rejectione quarundam ſingularium perſonarum decretum quum fieri nequeat ut ſit electio quin ſimul quò que ſit aliqua reprobatio aut derelictio difficiles omnes circa hunc articulum quaeſtiones temere excutere nihil aliud eſſe quam inutilibus diſputationibus nihil profuturis litibus eccleſiam replere ejus que pacem perturbare declarationem ſuam hanc libello ſupplice expreſſam moderatis omnibus pace • que amantibus ingeniis ſufficere debere credi videlicet ac doceri ab ipſis deum neminem condemnare imò verò ne ſtatuiſſe quidem condemnare quenquam niſi juſtè propter propria ipſius peccata placuit ita ſupplice illuſt hollandiae weſtfriziae ordinibus exhibito deprecati ſunt contraremonſtrantes ne de reprobatione ageretur large pag 195 thus ipſi contraremonſtrantes cum colloquio haghienſi juſſi eſſent ad interrogata quaedam noſtra de reprobatione reſpondere magiſtratui morem gerere gravati fuerint uſ que adeò ut collationem caeptam abrumpere ſe malle profiterentur quàm ut ſummarum poteſtatum collationis initio ſeptem queſtionibus ſpinoſis ac minime neceſſariis non tantum ad reprobationis ſed electionis quoque doctrinam ſpectantibus à recto agendi ordine contraremonſtrantes ambage adducere conarentur contraremonſtrantes libello ſupplice apud illuſtordd de tam iniquâ agendi ratione conqueſtos fuiſſe que ut remonſtrantibus mandaretur ne extra juſtam agendi rationem jam inchoatam synode gratifying remonſtrants yeelding motion made might liberty treat well reprobation election thus quoniam remonſtrantes aliquoties profeſſi ſunt ſe per conſcientiam synodo ſubſiſtere ulterius non poſſe niſi prius caveatur ipſis fore ut de electione reprobatione eâ ratione quam theſibus scriptis ſuis hactenus exhibitis propoſuerunt poſterùm agatur synodus quò magi ipſis fiat ſatis publice ac coràm omnibus declarat ſtatuiſſe ſeſe ac ſtatuere ſententiam ipſorum non de electione modò verum etiam de reprobatione expendere que examinare quantum nempe conſcientiâ ad dei gloriam aedificationem tranquillitatem eccleſiae omnium que conſcientiarum poſſe ac debere ſatis eſſe ipſa judicaret ad agendi verò modum qui hic eſt ſervandus ordinem quod attinet ſuum eſſe de eo diſpicere non autem fratrum remonſtrantium qui huc ſunt citati quicquam praeſcribere exiſtimat decree read remonſtrants refuſed give way unto 40 seſſion contains altercation thereabout synod forſooth would preſcribe synod de modo agendi synod muſt preſcribe profeſſe againſt seſſ 41 pag 155 manner nec ſatisfit nobis ſi dicatur synodum permiſſuram ut nostram de reprobatione ſententiam tractemus quoad illa ipſa ad gloriam dei aedificationem eccleſiarum conſcientiarum tranquillitatem fore judicabit nam hâc ipſâ reſtrictione nobis praeciditur libertas plenaria ſententiae noſtrae defenſio contrariae impugnatio praeterquam quòd non levi ſuſpicandi nobis data ſit occaſio synodum ubi no de electione diſſerentes audiverit nequaquam permiſſuram ut contraremonſtrantium eorum quos illi pro orthodoxis habent de reprobatione ſententiam prout neceſſarium judicabimus ad incudem revocari hereupon synod entreats judgement forraine divine one conſent profeſſe tantam remonſtrantibus libertatem ad defenſionem cauſae ſuae conceſſam eſſe quantâ ex ratione dignitate synodi citatis concedi poſſet ac proinde nullam eſſe cauſam cur synodicum decretum mutandum videretur aut cur remonſtrantes querelam inſtituerent vel authoritatem hujus synodi ſubterfugerent nihil illis eſſe imperatum quod ullo modo conſcientias ipſorum gravare poſſet ac proinde conſcientiae velum fruſtra pervicaciae obtendi abundè ii omnibus que modis ſatisfactum jam eſſe abſolutam illam nulliſ que circumſcriptam limitibus libertatem quam petunt à synodo concedi ipſis non poſſe aequum eſſe ut certis ſeſe legibus ſubmittant quibus ſi exorbitent coërceantur nay next seſſion seſſ 42 repreſentation made unreaſonable demand theſe word profeſſi ſunt ſibi agendi modum synodo praeſcriptum iniquum videri sibi permitti velle non tantum primo loco ſed circa omnes articulos theſes ſingula que argumenta de ſententiâ contraremonſtrantium corum quos illi pro orthodoxis habent quoad reprobationem agere quia hoc argumento calceus illos maximè urgeat hereupon opinion forraigne divine required wit whether fit yeeld unto treat reprobation treated election qui conſentientibus declarabant ſuffragiis ab omni ratione methodo eſſe alienum id quod remonſtrantes peterent ut prius de reprobatione quàm de electione agere ſibi liceret judgement hereupon repreſented ſeverally large firſt brittiſh divine palatine divine divine land heſſe helvetians thoſe correſpondency weteraw thoſe geneva thoſe breme laſtly thoſe emden 5 upon former bald baſe pretence concluſum eſſet contrà manichaeos author proceeds crowing magnificentiſsimè firſt pray conſider light make thing manifeſt light conference conference mompelgard diverſe thing diſputed beſides predeſtination truth manifeſted hereby thoſe particular pray let ſignify whoſe ſide whether part jacobus andreas part beza made manifeſt either ſide ſide whoſe ſide author conceives truth ſtand doe manifeſtly perceive crudity conceit nay ſeeth condition conference quality rather ability conferrer apt manifeſt truth ſuch men able manifeſt well conference diſcourſes either poſitive controverſiall conference yea farre better thoſe diſcourſes quietly carried free altercation controverſies conferre ſome caſes preferre conference penne beza conference word mouth though better pleaſed lipps jacobus andreas yet neither beza refuſe yeeld andreas way neither either judgement good reaſon refuſe muſt cenſured bluſhing light auſtin profeſſeth formerly vouched may many cauſes forbearing deliver truth ſome time little dreamed expoſing truth thereby ſuch cenſure bluſhed light ſome might juſtly cenſured bluſhing light muſt ſakes rule juſtice made obnoxious ſame cenſure doctor doctrine ſelfe apparent true ſound doctrine may weakly apprehended many though learned veritas eſt temporis filia accurate handling maintaining truth plainer point reprobation come perfection degree much ventilating ruder manner thus think crackt crowne concluſion may proceed rector particular congregation many addicted arminius admoniſhed manifeſt conſiderations ſeverall deanaries ſo might fairely ſent synod approached put alſo illi vero ut antea ita nunc quo que ſinguli conſuetis tergiverſationibus pariter hoc detrectarunt like refuſall afterwards made synod southholland though urged synod declare themſelves provinciall synod deferred two month longer whereupon synod decreed ſhould give conſiderations within month ſpace obnoxious cenſure eccleſiaſticall hereupon mean made utenbogard letter state unto thoſe paſtors ſend unto conſiderations ſealed ſo might reſerve provinciall synod ſhortly held theſe proceeding man may eaſily ſmell barnavells hand along hereupon came forth length arminius declaration state anſwer whereunto gomarus riſeth may read fol 6 pag 2 amongſt courſes arminius make relation spretis synodorum claſſium prebyteriorum judiciis ac decretis ad ſupremi magiſtratus tribunal prima inſtantia proſiluiſſe ibi que querelas que accuſationes ſuas diutius hâc uti fol 6 p 2 state repreſents continuall practice thereunto concealing opinion word theſe quibus inſuper artibus opiniones ſuas diſſeminare publicè ſcilicet ab eccleſiis rogatum obteſtatum que ſententiam ſuam occultare privatim vero paſtoribus quos eam pertrahi poſſe ſperaret ac diſcipulis ſuis diligentèr eam inculcare argumenta noſtrorum praecipua quibus astrui doctrina orthodoxa ſoleret enervare jeſuitarum verò aliorum que adverſariorum quibus doctrinam eccleſiarum reformatarum oppugnant confirmare varias de doctrinae receptae veritate dubitationes diſcipulorum animis ingerere eandem que cum doctrinâ heterodoxâ prius quaſi aequilibrio ſuſpendere ac deinde prorſus rejicere nullam hactenus ſinceritatis ac conſenſus doctrinâ licet ſaepius ab eccleſiis amanter learne ſomewhat nothing occupied arminian 3 let mee adde one thing article church ſeaventeenth concerning predeſtination election one concerning reprobation u ſhould forbeare meddle doctrine reprobation diſpute may juſtly plead faire conformity wiſdome church whereof member way touch one thing might reaſon author utterly pretermits proſecuting opinion concerning predeſtination election wit leaſt thereby ſhould fall foule upon doctrine church ſo evidently ſet downe article concerning poynt predeſtination church ireland content themſelves forme 17th article concerning predeſtination premiſe two theſes one whereof god eternity unchangeable councell ordaine whatſoever time ſhould come paſſe yet ſo thereby violence offered will reaſonable creature neither liberty contingency ſecond cauſe taken away eſtabliſhed rather ſame eternall counſell god hath predeſtinated ſome unto life reprobated ſome unto death certain number known unto god neither increaſed diminiſhed discourse third motive infamy opinion maintained supralapſarians odious papiſts open foule mouthes againſt church religion ſo abhorred maintained either way rhe lutheran tenent call u damned calveniſts think u unworthy ground writing proteſt rather unite themſelves papiſts u sir edwin sand ſpeaks men commends ſingular learning piety whoſe opinion ſo ſets declares think blemiſh reformed relat pag 194 198 doctor revive doctrine abate rigour certain ſpeculative opinion ſo pleaſed call eſpecially touching eternall decree god wherein ſome chief author runne ſuch utter oppoſition romiſh doctrine puniſhments theſe reaſons firſt ſort twisse conſideration doctrine ſee cryed downe infamous alſo stoicall manichaicall thought infamy conſiſted stoicality way fit coordinate genus specie multiplying friend loſt five senſes example ſight ſeeing ſo proceeded amplification mr baſtard condoling anſwered though loſt fight yet retained ſeeing ſome comfort true sir quoth plain fellow like ſort might ſay though doctrine poynt stoicall yet infamous ſome comfort heavy crimination laid charge stoicall infamous alſo let comfort nothing herein laid charg laid charg auſtin many hundred year agoe proſper teſtifies austin death practice pelagians prout ſibi obnoxias aliquorum aures opportunaſ que repererint ſcripta ejus quibus error pelagianorum impugnatur proſp epiſt ad ruffin infamant dicentes eum liberum arbitrium peni • ùs ſubmovere ſub gratiae nomine neceſſitatem praedicare fatalem neither free reproach lived appears diver paſſages contr duas epiſtol pelagiani lib 2 cap 5 sub nomine inquiunt gra •• ae ita fatum aſtruunt ut dicant quia niſi deus invito reluctanti homini • piraverit boni ipſius imperfecti cupiditatem nec à malo declinare nec bonum poſſet arripere objection anſwer followeth theſe word nec ſub nomine gratiae fatum aſſerimus quia nullis hominum meritis dicimus dei gratiam antecedi si autem quibuſdam omnipotentis dei voluntatem placet fati nomine nurcupari profanas quidem verborum novitates evitamus ſed de verbis contendere non amamus cap 6 fatum qui affirmant de ſyderum poſitione ad tempus quo concipitur quiſ que vel naſcitur quas conſtellationes vocant non ſolùm actus eventa veram etiam ipſas noſtras voluntates pendere contendunt dei verò gratia non ſolùm omnia ſydera omnes caelos utrum etiam omnes angelos ſupergreditur deinde fati aſſertores bona mala hominum fato tribuunt deus autem mali hominum meritis eorum debita retributione proſequitur bona verò per indebitam gratiam miſericordi voluntate largitur utrum que faciens non per ſtellarum temporale conſortium ſed per ſuae ſeveritatis bonitatis aeternum altum que conſilium neutrum ergò pertinere videmus ad fatum cap 8 iam de gratia fato quàm inani alloquuntur oſtendimus nunc illud est quod debemus advertere utrum invito reluctanti homini deus inſpiret boni cupiditatem ut jam non ſit reluctans non ſit invitus ſed conſentiens bono volens bonum like ſort pelagians charged auſtin manicheiſme de nupt concupiſc lib 2 cap 3 anſwereth thus quid obtendis ad fallendum communis dogmatis tegmen ut operias proprium crimen unde vobis inditum eſt nomen que ut nefario vocabulo terras imperites dicis ne igitur vocentur haeretici fiant manichaei large contr duas epiſt pelag ad bonifacium cap 2 manichaei dicunt deum bonum non omnium natuarrum eſſe creatorem pelagiani dicunt deum non eſſe omnium aetatum hominibus mundatorem ſalvatorem liberatorem catholica utroſ que redarguit contra manichaeos defendens dei creaturam ne ab illo inſtituta negetur ulla creatura contrà pelagianos ut omnibus aetatibus perdita requiratur humana natura 2 manichaei carnis concupiſcentiam non tanquam accidens vitium ſed tanquam naturam ab aeternitate malam vituperant pelagiani eam tanquam nullum vitium ſed naturale ſit bonum inſuper laudant catholica utroſ que redarguit manichaeis dicens non natura ſed vitium eſt pelagianis dicens non à patre ſed ex mundo eſt ut eam velut malam valetudinem ſanari utr • que permittant deſinendo illi tanquam inſanabilem credere iſti tanquam laudabilem praedicare 3 manichaei negant homini bono ex libro arbitrio fuiſſe initium mali pelagiani dicunt etiam hominem malum ſufficienter habere liberum arbitrium ad faciendum praeceptum bonum catholica utroſ que redarguit illis dicens fecit deus hominem rectum iſtis dicens ſi vos filius liberaverit verè liberi eritis 4 manichaei dicunt animam particulam dei naturae malae commixtione habere peccatum pelagiani dicunt animam juſtam non quidem particulam ſed creaturam dei etiam iſtâ corruptibili vitâ non habere peccatum catholica utroſ que redarguit manichaeis dicens aut facile arborem bonam fructum ejus bonum aut facile arborem malam fructum ejus malum pelagianis dicens ſi dixerimus quia non habemus peccatum noſmetipſos ſeducimus morbis inter ſe contrariis manichaei pelagiani que confligunt diſſimili voluntate ſimili vanitate ſeperati opinione diverſâ ſed propinqui mente perverſâ iam verò gratiam chriſti ſimul oppugnant baptiſmum ejus ſimul evacuant carnem ejus ſimul inhonorant ſed etiam hoc modis cauſiſ que diverſis nam manichaei meritis naturae bonae pelagiani autem meritis voluntatis bonae perhibent divinitus ſubveniri illi dicunt debet hoc deus laboribus membrorum ſuorum iſti dicunt debet hoc virtutibus ſuorum utriſ que ergò merces non imputatur ſecundum gratiam ſed ſecundum debitum ſtarres becauſe thoſe glorious body infatuate world ſhew divinity lord laboured prevent jewes deutr 4 marvail vulgar ſort acknowledge fate auſtin ſaith de civit dei lib 5 cap 1 id fatum homines quando audiunt uſitatâ loquendi confuetudine non intelligunt niſi vim poſitionis ſyderum qualis eſt quando quis naſcitur ſive concipitur doe find stoicks thus diſtinguiſh series cauſarum comprehended cauſes caeleſtiall ſublunary ramus indeed conceived ſuch difference poſſidonius chryſippus stoicks turnebus make bold tell herein erred quod autem poſsidonium dicis studio aſtrologiae oblectatum fatum ſyderibus attribuiſſe eo peccas quod aliam ejus quam chryſippi ſententiam putas nec eam totam complecteris nam ſi ſimul aegrotantibus fratribus cauſam eſſe dicebat ſyderum caeli conſtitutione affectione non tamen idcircò aliis rebus fatum non eſſe judicabat nay profeſſeth according stoicks fatum god himſelfe nature fatum underſtood omnem naturae contagionem cicero phraſe indeed whole frame nature knit together per contactum cicero called naturae contagionem prof much poſſidonius cicero de divinatione quintus therein profeſſing according opinion poſſidonius force courſe divination derived god deſtiny nature concludes therehence kind artificiall naturall divination opinion comprehended notion fate cicero ſecond book divination ſhewes whereas poſſidonius opinion vim quandam ſentientem divinam quae tota confuſa ſit mundo ad hoſtiam deligendam ducere concludes thus satis ut opinor ſignificat poſſidonium non ſyderibus tantum fatum poſuiſſe ſed per omnem mundi continuationem naturae conjunctionem ordinem ſeriem que cauſarum permanare credidiſſe idem poſſidonius ſaith 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ſcripſerat quod non feciſſet ſi ſyderibus tantum fatum eſſe ſenſiſſet like poſsidonius inſiſt ſtarres confirmation fate ſo neither chryſippus inferior cauſes neceſſitatem nature acutus interpres taxeth ramus ad chryſippum pertinere aſtrorum ad poſſidonium credidiſti errorem errore cumulaſti nam nec poſsidonius ſolis aſtris fatum ponebat ſed totâ naturae contagione ut ſuprà docui chryſippus eâdem naturae contagione quâ etiam aſtra continentur quod non intellexiſti prof cicero anſwering chryſippus manner ut igitur ad quaſdam re natura locus pertinet ad quaſdam autem nihil ſie affectio aſtrorum valeat ſivis ad quaſdam re ad omnes certè non valebit chryſippum enim alloquitur ſaith turnebus ut vel puero notum eſt ut tui pudeat pigeat qui poſſidonium intelligis thus diſciplines ramus proceed farther ſaying chryſippum autem aſtrorum conſtitutione affectione fatum poſuiſſe audi ex cicerone ſi quis verbi cauſâ oriente caniculâ natus eſt mari non morietur vigila chryſippe c nihil iſtud argumentum thus turnebus concludes herehence niſi etiam astris fatum poneret thereof thoſe moſt ſtudied hiſtory stoicks find denied liberty men man power either forbeare doth doe thing forbear doe rather contrary made choyce ſome leaſt though auſtin delivers without ſuch melancthons epistle peucer bezas confeſsion life calvin anſwer 1 author either better read melancthon luther ſo juſt matter could find luther cry abſolute nature god decree 2 beza report melancthon ſeems ſome epiſtle peucer might ground therein delivers mind meerly upon laelius relation de stoico fato uſ que adeò litem genevae moveri ut quidam carcerem conjectus ſit propterea quod •• one differret ſay laelius relation made unto melancthon whereupon melancthon ſaith mijera tempora doctrina ſalutis peregrinis quibuſdam diſputationibus obſcuratur 3 melancthon died foure year calvin one anno 1560 1564 therefore paſſe cenſure church geneva calvin day many year death calvin great melancthon ſo well known eſteemed calvin appeal melancthons judgement point de caenâ domini mentioned oſiander hiſt eccleſ cent 16 anno 1558 pag 666 two year death likewiſe poynt freewill predeſtination appears calvin epiſtle unto prefixed book de libero arbitrio ſent unto melancthon ever known melancthon paſſeth cenſure upon 4 grotius like manner objected melancthon ſee pray lubbertus anſwereth reſpon ad pietatem grotii quod ad melancthonem attinet erras ſi ipſam ſtare pro remonſtrantibus exiſtimas c idem melancthon 9 ad romanos cur inquit no ad evangelium vocavit non vocavit alexandrum macedonem auguſtum socratem pomponium atticum qui non minus civilitèr vivebant quàm no hic neceſſe eſt cauſam rejicere voluntatem dei et jacob electus eſt eſau reprobatus priuſquam quicquam boni vel mali feciſſent ergo opera non erant cauſa ſed voluntas vocantis non addam hic quomodo cavillentur ista nonnulli tantum hoc meminerit lector ſi opera ſecutura vita erunt cauſa electionis non licuit apoſtolo dicere non ex operibus ex conſtat ſait lubbertus melancthonem idem cum calvino luthero de praedeſtinatione ſenſiſle fatetur hoc ipſe melancthon ad calvinum ſuo inquiens haec cum tuis congruere ſed mea ſunt 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 ad uſum accommodata idem epiſtolâ ad eraſmum ego integrâ conſcientiâ non poſſum lutheri dogma damnare proceeds farther ſhew different method uſed delivering doctrine praedeſtination calvinus ſaith à priori docet illos qui electi ſunt immutabili dei conſilio electos eſſe que inde infert illos perire non poſſe melancthon verò poſteriori docet no ex verâ fide ſeriâ reſipiſcentiâ diſcere quòd ſumus electi ego credo jeſum chriſtum ſeriò reſipiſco ergo ſum electus que ita ipſâ conſentiunt hanc enim melancthonis argumentationem approbat calvinus illam calvini approbat melancthon tantum abeſt ut alter alterius doctrinam rejiciat aut contemnat 5 obſerved relation made epiſtle melancthons unto calvin could reſt ſatisfied untill ſeen epiſtle ſelfe length found amongſt calvin epiſt 49 therein coming poynt ad quaeſtionem ſaith de praedeſtinatione habebam amicum tubingae doctum hominem franciſcum stadianum qui dicere ſolebat ſe utrum que probare evenire omnia ut divina providentia decrevit tamen eſſe contingentia ſed ſe haec conciliare non poſſe gotten one friend looked friend melancthons alſo end doth make mention hereof give calvin underſtand tubing wanted ſuch concurred opinion touching eveniency thing decree god providence yet might well conſiſt liberty man quietare intellectum thereupon ſaith ego captivo meum obſequium fidei quo ſaith alvarez doctiſſimè pi • ſſimè loquitur melancthon go repreſent carriage teaching ego ſaith cùm hypotheſin hanc teneam deum non eſſe cauſam peccati nec velle peccatum poſteà contingentiam hâc nostrâ infirmitate judicii admitto ut ſciant rudes davidem ſuâ voluntate ultrò ruere eundem ſentio cum haberet ſpiritum ſanctum potuiſſe cum retinere eâ lucta aliquam eſſe voluntatis actionem theſe thing grant afterwards agree doctrine calvin may man proceed farther diſpute hereof ſomething accurately denyes haec etiamſi ſubtilius diſputari poſſunt tamen ad regendas mentes hoc modo propoſita accommodata videntur ſame manner go accuſemus ipſi noſtram voluntatem cùm labimur non quaeramus dei conſilio cauſam vanity conſequence conſider pray 1 ſhould argue thus plain termes ſinne alwaies meritorious cauſe damnation therefore ſinne meritorious cauſe god eternall decree damnation enthymeme hath force farther divine underſtand wit jewes gentile thus aquinas sasbutius popiſh divine interpret aquinas word theſe omnia id eſt omne hominum genus tam judaeos quam gens incredulitate concluſit ut omnium miſereatur id eſt ut omni hominum genere miſericordia locum habeat non eſt extendendum ad omnes homines ſigillatim ſed ad omnia genus hominum fit enim hic diſtributio pro generibus ſingulorum non pro ſingulis generum cajetan concluſit permiſſive omnes tam judaeos quam gens peccatum infidelitatis text ſelfe doth cleerely juſtify appears two verſes immediatly preceding wherewith coheres v 30 even gentile time paſt believed god yet obtained mercy jewes unbeliefe 31 even ſo jewes believed mercy ſhewed gentile alſo jewes may obtain mercy conſtruction embraced old austin appears beda upon roman alleadging auguſt de civit dei lib 21 concluſit deus omnes infidelitate ut omnium miſereatur quos omnes niſi de quibus loquebatur tanquam dicens vos illos deus ergo gentile judaeos quos praeſcivit praedeſtinavit much time preſent lord mercy nation gentile time ſhould come god would alſo mercy jewes conſequently ſhould come paſſe surely till 1600 year wit time cometh appoynted effectuall generall calling nation jewes foundation moſt rotten marvail edifice build hereupon muſt need totter jewes thus ſhut infidelity many hundred year wit untill time came apoſtle propheſyeth ſo gentile alſo till time came calling thus sasbutius interpreteth apoſtle place senſus est ſaith ſic viſum eſt deo diſpenſare utriuſ que populi ſalutem iudaeorum videlicet gentium ut permitteret utrum que populum ſuo vitio populo tam iudaeorum quam gentium thus ſee alls worth bodkin give two alls encreaſe ſtore may juſtly ſay nothing purpoſe discourse sect iii iohn 3 16 god ſo loved world gave begotten sonne whoſoever c come know god negation rather affirmation capreolus upon firſt sentence diſt 2 queſt 1 rehearſeth diverſe paſſages aquinas purpoſe 1 contra gens cap 14 conſideratione divinae ſubſtantiae praecipue utendum eſt via remotionis nam divina ſubſtantia omnem formam quam intellectus noſter attingit ſuâ excedit immenſitate et ſic ipſam apprehendere non peſſumus cognoſcendo quid eſt ſed aliqualiter ejus notitiam habemus cognoſcendo quid non eſt tantóque ejus notitiae magi appropinquamus quanto plura per intellectum noſtrum poterimus ab eo removere tanto enim unumquodque perfectiùs cognoſcitur quanto differentia ejus ab alio pleniùs intuemur quià conſideratione divinae ſubſtantiae non poſſumus accipere quid quaſi genus nec diſtinctionem ab aliis rebus per differentia affirmativas accipere poſſumus eam oportet accipere per differentia negativas id 3 contra gens cap 47 per effectus dei pertingere poſſumus ut cognoſcamus de deo quia eſt quod cauſa aliorum est aliis ſupereminens ab omnibus remotus hoc eſt ultimum perfectiſſimum noſtrae cognitionis hac vitâ ut dionyſius dixit lib de myſticâ theologiâ cum deo quaſi ignoto conjungimur quod quidem contingit cùm de deo quid non ſit cognoſcimus quid vero ſit penitùs manet ignotum unde ad hujuſmodi ſublimiſſimae cognitionis ignorantiam demonſtrandam dicitur de moſe exod 20 quod acceſsit ad caliginem qua deus er conſideration divine eſſence muſt ſubjoyne ſpeciall reaſon thus maldonate de quo verbo nimis fortaſſe ſubtiliter quidam diſputant quomodo melius iudae fuiſſet natum non eſſe cum non eſſe nullum damnatum eſſe aliquod bonum ſit aliquid enim eſt qui damnatus eſt omne autem quod eſt qua est bonum eſt hieronymus judicat exiſtimaſſe aliquos iudam fuiſſe antequam naſceretur chriſtum que certo conſilio non dixiſſe melius fuiſſet homini illi ſi numquam fuiſſet ſed ſi natus non eſſet quaſi etiamſi non naſceretur futurus fuiſſet ideo que naturalia bona ſine mali habiturus suſpicor hieronymum originiſtas notare voluiſſe qui omnes anima initio creatas fuiſſe crediderunt pro ſuo quamque merito aut expertem manere corporis aut corpus tanquam carcerem mitti vero origines ipſe ita hoc loco ſcribere videtur ut non longe ab eâ ſententiâ abhorrere videatur eodem fere modo enthymius interpretatur length addes interpretation place word following sed non ſunt hujuſmodi scripturae locutiones ad scholarum excutiendae ſubtilitatem ſunt enim proverbiales ſumptae de vulgo quibus quidam plerum que hyperbolicum eſſe ſolet ut apud job cap 3 11 quare non vulvâ mortuus ſum egreſſus ex utero non ſaltem perii et cap 10 18 19 quare de vulvâ aduxiſti qui utinam conſumptus eſſem ne oculus videret fuiſſem quaſi non eſſem de utero tranſlatus ad tumulum et cap 3 3 et jer 20 14 pereat dy qua natus ſum haec enim omnia non tam deliberato animi judicio quam per querimoniam quae mala ſua amplificare ſolet dictum ſunt chriſtus ergo ita de juda loquitur quemadmodum credibile erat ipſum de ſe ſuppliciis poſitum eſſe loquuturum erat autem credibile eum dicturum eſſe utinam nunquam natus eſſem melius mihi fuiſſet non naſci quam iſta pati cum job jeremias viri ſanctiſſimi multo minor paſſi idem dixerint adde quod chriſtus non dicit melius futurum fuiſſe ut juda non naſcitur ſed melius futurum illi eſſe id eſt ejus opinione judicio quemadmodum multis re adverſas patientibus accidere videmus ut corrupto dolore judicio mortem vitae anteponant cum dubium non ſit melius eſſe vivere quam mori 2 come compariſon make men devills objecting doctrine make god leſſe mercifull men devills one thing ſaith decree make moſt men devills reprobation cannot reconciled juſtice divine ſay need reconcilement inſipid thing talke courſe reconciling never odds take upon prove repugnancy three reaſons 1 firſt whereof make god puniſh righteous conſidered without ſinne true confeſſe true preſent conſidered without righteouſneſſe alſo good reaſon becauſe god decree eternall creature time conſider thing hath ſo much conſiderare conſider errare fingere erre feign delivered vindiciae gratiae dei firſt part firſt book author pretend hath read ſecond yet take courſe refute ought elſe let goe god ſaith made determine infliction miſery men without conſideration ſinne either originall actuall firſt let granted yet herehence followeth made deſtroyer righteous puniſh righteous wicked affirmed determine puniſhment one thing puniſh another thing certainly opinion thoſe ſpeaks god puniſheth none wicked conſcience author cannot convict falſhood crimination certainly opinion doth follow every one found wicked god doth puniſh may well ſay moſt abſolute congruity opinion god doth puniſh men creation ſuch indeed neither wicked righteous god paſſed decree reprobation upon neither doe theſe divine maintain god decree damne man ſinne nay goe farther let object reprobation men yet created ſo conſidered proved ſo herehence way followes decree reprobration moment reaſon nature conſideration citra conſiderationem peccati alſo proved author boldly ſuppoſeth contrary true without proofe yet pretend hath read vindiciae gratiae dei farther handled ſay pretend doe know come may capon come chicken hence proceeds sublapſarians alſo whole synod dort ti ſuppoſed brittain divine againſt way hath tyed himſelfe bend reaſons ſo pope grant doth never bind hand author hath power untye himſelfe pleaſure fly againſt supralapſarians alſo scanderbeg againſt two perſian challenger put thereunto becauſe contrary compact ſet champion like tall fellow brave ſpirit ſhould hand full whole synod let fly indeed mean sublapſarians conſider meerely upon pleaſure god yet ſay naturall leprous perſon beget leprous perſon ſo naturall borne fleſh fleſh though depends upon conſtitution god albeit adam loſt ſpirit god tranſgreſſion ſupernaturall grace wherewith endued yet like god regeneration meere pleaſure reſtored afterwards adam due time doth reſtore every one elect ſo conception pleaſed god could chriſts ſake infuſe peccatum originis totum genus humanum diffuſum eſſe quod eſt totius naturae corruptio vitium haereditarium quo ipſi infantes matris ſuae utero polluti ſunt quodque veluti radix omne peccatorum genus homine producit ideo que ita foedum execrabile eſt coram deo ut ad generis humani condemnationem ſufficiat brittain divine ſecond theſis upon third fourth article explicate themſelves concerning condition originall ſinne manner lapſae voluntati ineſt non tantum peccandi poſſibilitas ſed etiam praeceps ad peccandum inclinatio nec aliter ſe poteſt re habere homine corrupto nondum per divinam juſtitiam reſtaurato cùm ea ſit natura voluntatis ut nuda manere nequeat ſed ab uno cui adhaeſerat objecto excidens aliud quaerat quod cupidè amplectatur ideo per ſpontaneam defectionem habitualiter adverſa deo creatore creaturam effraeni impetu fertur ac cum ea libidinoſe ac turpiter fornicatur ſemper avida fruendi utendis ac vetita moliendi ac patrandi quid mirum ergo ſi talis voluntas ſit diaboli maneipium find indeed corvinus ſuch profeſſion namely ex puro dei arbitrio qui adami peccatum nobis imputare voluit etiam no reatus derivatus eſt walaeus anſwer unto writes thus nec quinto illo ad rom capite ad quod no hic corvinus remittit quicquam tale dicitur aut innuitur nempe quod ex mero dei arbittio pendeat haec primo peccati imputatio 2 second thing put upon divine god hath determined ſinne caſt away farre greater part mankind ever ſo make god doe two act one accompanying ſay one anſwer firſt ſay god doth two act ſay god one ſeeing proved doe way maintain god doth puniſh righteous wicked immodeſt unſhamefact crimination doe maintain god determined damne ſinne ſuppoſing humanum genus nondum conditum object reprobation yet doth follow moment nature decree damnation conſideration ſinne ſurely neither follow sublapſarian doctrine god doth decree puniſh man damnation thoſe ſinnes wherein dyeth unrepented much leſſe god doth puniſh righteous wicked crimination author propoſed doubt againſt conſcience ti true ſome periſh originall ſinne juſtly borne child wrath ſtrange dye child wrath juſt god inflict eternall death author profeſſeth guilty eternall death ſaith god meer pleaſure make guilty eternall death ſaying though ſay originall ſinne make man guilty eternall death free conſtitution god yet ſay free conſtitution god made meer pleaſure juſto dei judicio▪ like whoſoever belief ſhall damned damnation free conſtitution god made portion unbeliever dare author inferre herehence made ſo juſto dei judicio indeed god give grace according meere pleaſure wiſe man ſay damnes men according meere pleaſure phraſe implies cauſe thereof man part indeed cauſe man part god ſhould give grace cauſe enough man part god ſhould inflict damnation yet work god though juſt never whit leſſe free damning originall ſinne though god conſtitution hereof juſt yet never whit leſſe free though free yet never whit leſſe juſt like damnation inflicted finall impenitents ſola dei conſtitutione vertue conſtitution divine whoſoever repents ſinne ſhall damned apparent god might annihilated ſo pleaſed yet never whit leſſe juſt like ſort ſole conſtitution god originall ſinne propagated men chriſt excepted god could derived mankind another ſtock adam fall doth regenerate men uſually word ſo might pleaſed conception give ſpirit thoſe ſupernaturall grace whereof adam deprived ſinne yet propagation ſinne adam poſterity never whit leſſe juſt whit leſſe naturall like whole courſe nature depends upon alone conſtitution god ſay god without reſpect ſinne 3 4 vult word theſe adhaec etſi deus interdum ſignificet ſe velle quod non vult non tamen propterea hypocriſeos inſimulandus eſt vorſtius objected unto sed potius ſapientia ejus agnoſcenda hominibus ad ſerias preces ſeriam poenitentiam adducendis ut liquet exemplo begis ezekiae recuperantis ſanitatem ninivitarum conſervatorum whereas vorstius lay charge ſaying god command one thing purpoſeth another doth impute unto god hypocriſy ſubſtance author anſwere place see pray anſwers without attributing holy ſimulation unto god caſe ad praecepta vero quod attinet non ſtatim ſequitur deum agere hipocritam ſi quid praecipiat quod fieri nolit etenim hypocritam demum agit qui ſimulat pietatem quâ caret sane quicquid praecipit deus id vult voluntare approbante ſi fiat niſi interveniat praeceptum contrarium ut factum eſt praecepto quod dederat abrahamo de mactando iſaaco interim tamen voluntate decernente non vult ut ſinguli ea faciant quae omnibus geneſ 22 praecipit ut liquet caede chriſti per judam judaeos perpetratâ act 2 4 hereupon look farther conſider vorſtius hath anſwered unto vorſtius anſwer hereunto amic duplic p 137 non tantum hypocrita eſt qui pietatem ſimulat quâ caret ſed ille qui dolosè alterum ſub blandâ ſpecie decipit offerens ei ſalutem quam nunquam animo habuit ipſi dare piſcator anſwer hereunto doth diſtinguiſh hypocriſy holy ſimulation denyed former god affirmed participatione ſacramentorum externa conſistens erant ſanctificati hoc eſt judaeis paganis profeſſione ſegregati pro veris chriſtianis habiti loquitur enim ſecundum judicium charitatis quae omnes de doctrina conſentientes habet pro ſanctificatis licet non omnes cordibus vere ſint ſanctificati non eergo hinc ſequitur apoſtatas vere fuiſſe regeneratos pro quibus enim chriſtus ne quidem dignatus eſt eos multo minus ſanguine ſuo ſanctificavit ideo johannes apoſtatas de eccleſia renatorum fuiſſe negat ex nobis egreſſi ſunt quia non erant ex nobis et petrus vocat eos cane porcos redentes ad vomitum volutabrum canis vero etiam poſt vomitum est canis ſus lota eſt ſus canem vero ſuem ſe ſemper manſiſſe ille iſta per reditum ad vomitum volutabrum declarat cameron likewiſe myroth p 334 dupliciter ſanctificantur homines alii abſolute ut ſoli fideles cum ſcilicet non tantum ab aliis hominibus ſegregantur hoc enim verbum ſanctificare ſaepe ſignificat scriptura deo ſed remiſſione peccatorum apprehenſa spiritus sancti virtute ſanctificati ſanctitatis studio permanent alii comparate qui ſcilicet ſeparantur quidem ab aliis hominibus externa fidei profeſſione aliqua fortè vitae inſtituti immutatione non ſanctificantur abſolute ut fideles ad hoc poſterius ſanctificationis genus pertinet hoc apoſtoli dictum quo ſanctificatus fuit albeit truly ſanctified ſuppoſe preſent yet god purpoſed give perſeverance therein undoubtedly intended ſalvation nay arminian denies god everlaſting intend ſalvation ſuch apoſtates ſay velleity ſave daſh man ſelfe againſt rock abſurdity deny god omnipotency unleſſe ſay god mind changed talke conditionate intending ſalvation ſay intends ſalvation caſe doe believe ſay intends damnation caſe doe believe allegation ſuffrages divine synod dort doe perſevere condition wit touching outward emendation life ut mitius puniantur auſtin expreſſeth himſelfe ſomewhere doth come remembrance fall whereupon ſhall grievouſly puniſhed also intended god obdurat miſereri eujus vult voluntates hominum quas vult bonum convertere see lib 1 de grat chriſti contra pelag caeleſt cap 46 cite ſaying ambroſe sed deus quem dignatur vocat quem vult religioſum currentis ſed miſerentis dei quia ut dicit etiam noſtrorum temporum homo ejus quem dignatur vocat quem vult religioſum facit miſereri rom 9 18 one vocare religioſum facere lib 1 ad simplician cap 2 unde datur intelligi quod infra utrum que poſuit ergo cujus vult miſeretur quem vult indurat ita ſententiae ſuperiori poteſt congruere ut obduratio dei ſit nolle miſereri ut non ab illo irrogetur aliquid quo ſit homo deterior ſed tantum quo ſit melior non erogetur quod ſi fit nulla diſtinctione meritorum quis non erumpat eam vocem quam ſibi objecit apoſtolus dicis ita que mihi quid adhuc paſſe conditionally 2 accordingly man end determined abſolute decree like unto riſing sunne riſing sunne god determined come paſſe abſolutely ſo ſpeciall end men wit salvation damnation theſe end men author ſpeakes theſe ſaid determined come paſſe abſolutely conditionally therefore men action hereabouts vaine fruitleſſe reaſon becauſe man salvation determined befall caſe believe repent become whether men ſleepe wake whether idle well occupied ſo make sunne ſhine raine fall upon juſt unjuſt indeed man action furthering salvation vaine fruitleſſe antecedent notorous untruth saviour hath profeſſed expreſſe termes whoſoever believeth ſhall saved whoſoever belief ſhall damned liberty power man performe faith repentance whether granted unto queſtion author might diſcuſſed pleaſed taken upon maintaine univerſall grace decline throughout like others ſect fearing therein ſome precipice herein willing grant god hath abſolutely determined ſome ſhall believe repent hath determined sunne riſing upon condition man according meere pleaſure beſtowing grace faith ſome denying others god beſtow faith man upon condition ſome precedent work man grace ſhould given according men work phraſe antients according men merit direct pelagianiſme condemned synod paleſtine twelve hundred year agoe author carrieth himſelfe prepoſterouſly thus confounding two queſtions one one whether ſalvation determined god conferred abſolutely man deny much himſelfe doth whether faith repentance determined god conferred man conditionally maintaine wonder little author ſtomack working like raging sea praedeſtinet ad vitam regni caelorum ut ſi nolent orare aut jejunare aut omni operé divino vigiles eſſe eos omnino perire non poſse nec prorſus ſui debere eſſe ſollicitos quos deus quia voluit ſemel vitam illis aeternam toto dari non poſſe ſic electione praedeſtinatos eſſe ut pereant judge pray whether objection charged upon doctrine auſtin author chargeth upon doctrine indeed moſt learned biſhop proſperitie aparent doth would wiſe man conclude hence bootleſſe either call parliament make uſe privy councelors author perhaps reply abſolutely ordaine period ſtate much period brought paſſe meanes expreſſe scripture find poſſe ſi velit one thing poſſe ſimply delivered another thing find diſtinguiſhed place auſtines retractations whereas ſayd lib 1 de gen contr man cap 3 omnes homines poſſunt ſi velint credere ab amore viſibilium rerum temporalium ſe ad dei praecerta implenda convertere comming retract perceiving advantage pelagians might ſ • atch hence countenancing cauſe extolling power nature wiſely prevents expounding himſelfe clearing owne meaning thus non exiſtiment novi haeretici pelagiani ſecundum eos eſſe dictum manifeſting thereby pelagian tenet yet blamed becauſe called god grace helpe ſave way inſtruction auſtin concurred ſtill particular even wrote book retractations followes theſe word verum eſt enim omnino marke emphaſis aſſurance faith delivered omnes homines hoc poſſe ſi velint thus farre go along marke wherin go beyond theſe word following sed praeparatur voluntas domino tantum augetur munere charitatis ut poſſint ſayeth praeparatur voluntas domino effect thereof undoubtedly ut velint ſtate condition regenerate yet may complaine cannot doe would apoſtle formerly ſignifies ſimply effectually yet power enough therefore auſtin addes preparation ut velint augmentation ſtrength ut poſſint ſaying tantum que augetur munere charitatis ut poſſint good ſo intenſely prevaile fleſh luſting againſt ſpirit whereby come ut non modo velint ſed poſſint conſequently efficiant quod velint poſſe ſimpliciter doth include velle addes ſuch ſtrength thereto goe will without reſtraint fleſh poſſe augmentation gratious diſpoſition appeares ſame austin de corrept gratia cap 11 prima gratia est qua ſit ut habeat homo juſtitiam ſi velit ſecunda ergo plus poteſt qua etiam ſit ut velit tantum velit tanto que ardore diligat ut carnis voluntatem contraria concupiſcentem voluntate ſpiritus vincat firſt grace whereby man may righteouſneſſe therfore ſecond grace power whereby man made ſuch meaſure ſpirit overcome fleſh affecting contrary thereunto next chapter c 12 calles prevailing poſſe ſimply tantum ſpiritu ſancto accenditur voluntas eorum ut ideo poſſint quia ſic velint ideo velint quia deus ſic operatur ut velint ſuch meaſure inflamed holy spirit therefore able doe good becauſe ſuch meaſure therefore ſuch meaſure becauſe god ſo work make willing ſuch meaſure auſtin go manner nam ſi tanta infirmitate vitae hujus ipſis relinqueretur voiuntas ſua ut adjutorio dei manerent ſi vellent nec deus ii operaretur ut vellent inter tot tantas tentationes infirmitate ſua voluntas ipſa ſuccumberet ideo perſeverare non poſſent quia deficientes infirmitate nec vellent aut non ita vellent infirmitate voluntatis ut poſſent ſo great infirmitie life left unto thē helpe god might continue would god ſhould work would amongſt ſo many ſo great tentations ſelfe would ſinke burthen therefore could perſevere becauſe failing infirmity would leaſt would ſuch meaſure will infirmity able ſtand poſſe ſimpliciter ſtill auſtin includes denomination ariſing ſtrength ſuis ſua gratia praeveniendo velle ſubſeqendo poſſe againe gratiam accipimus cum no deus praevenit ut velimus ſubſequitus ut poſſimus againe gratia dei praevenit ut bonum quod ſprevit cupiat ſequitur ut illud implere praevaleat effect poſſe come one agere perficere quod volumus good ſo affectionately prevaile fleſh luſting againſt inward impediment thus maſtered perfecting muſt needes follow poſſe chriſti contra pelag caeleſt firſt cap 6 pelagius word theſe qui ipſius voluntatis operis poſſibilitatem dedit whereupon austin writeth thus hanc autem poſſibilitatem natura eum ponere de verbis ejus ſuperioribus clarum eſt sed ne nihil de grati dixiſſe videretur adjunxit qui que ipſam poſſibilitatem gratiae ſuae adjuvat ſemper auxilio non ait ipſam voluntatem vel ipſam operationem quod ſi diceret non abhorrere doctrina apoſtolica videretur much ſay acknowledge ſhould good catholique ad juvare voluntatem operationem auſtins phraſe effectually operari ut velit operetur homo quod bonum eſt appeares followeth sed ait wit pelagius ipſam poſſibilitatem illud videlicet ex tribus quod natura locavit gratiae ſuae adjuvat ſemper auxilio marke auſtins interpretation thus ut ſcilicet voluntate actione non ideo laus ſit dei hominis quia ſic vult homo ut tamen ejus voluntati deus ardorem dilectionis inſpiret ſo adjuvare voluntatem auſtins phraſe inſpirare voluntati dilectationis ardorem ſee reſpect author uſually ſpeakes abſolute conditionall god uttererly deny god diſpenſation adminiſtration execution theſe proceeds ever decree proceed according meere pleaſure owne altogether according theire workes albeit god hath made law according whereto meanes proceed giving denying grace yet hath made law according whereto proceeds beſtowing salvation inflicting damnation law whoſever believeth ſhall saved whoſoever believeth ſhall bedamned 2 cor 5 10 must appeare judgement seate chriſt every man may receive thing done body according hath done whether good evill according ſence wherein author uſually ſpeakes abſolute conditionall god utterly deny god doth abſolutely elect man salvation reject man unto damnation though doth abſolutely elect ſome unto grace grace regeneration grace faith repentance abſolutely reject others much beſtowes theſe grace ſome denies unto others according workes according meere pleaſure owne doth inflict damnaton beſtow salvation according meere accounted ignava ratio thus turnebus writes ignava autem iſta ratio captioſa cum eſſet calumniae plenum carneade non probabatur alio que argumento factum ſine ulla captione oppugnabat manner reaſons oppoſe fate stoicall ſo ſorry argumentation delivered turnebus upon paſſage cicero book de fato ſheweth chryſippus make anſwer unto argument effect 1600 yeares goe take word lye cicero nec no impediet illa ignava ratio quae dicitur appellatur enim quidem philoſophis 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 cui ſi pare amus nihil est omnino quod agamus vita hic enim interrogant beſeech marke argument well ſi fatum tibi eſt ex hoc morbo convaleſcere ſive medicum adhibueris ſive non convaleſces item ſi fatum tibi eſt ex hoc morbo non convaleſcere ſive tu medicum adhibueris ſive non non convaleſces deſtined ſhall recover diſeaſe whether uſe help phyſitian ſhall recover againe deſtined ſhall recover diſeaſe whether uſe phyſitian ſhall recover compare pray author argumentation place choſen muſt neceſsity believe phyſitian like ſort unreaſonable conceive god hath deſtined man ripe yeares brought ſalvation faith chriſt god hath appoynted man damned want faith want repentance obſerve pray cenſure paſſed upon cicero rectè hoc genus interrogationis ignavum que iners nominatur quod eadem ratione omnis è vita tollitur actio farther ſheweth ſame argument force might place without mention fate licet etiam immutare ſaith ut fati nomen non adjunges eandem tamen teneas ſententiam hoc modo ſi ex eternitate verum hoc fuit ex iſte morbo convaleſces ſive adhibueris medicum ſive non convaleſces item que ſi ex aeternitate hoc falſum fuerit ex iſto morbo convaleſces ſive adhibuer medicum ſive non adhibuer non convaleſces deinde caetera next place ſhewed chryſippus made anſwer argument haecratio cryſipo reprehenditur quaedam enim ſunt inquit rebus ſimplicia quaedam copulata ſimplex est moretur eo die socrates hinc ſive quid fecerit ſive non fecerit finitus eſt moriendi dy ſi ita fatum ſit naſcetur oedipus laio non poterit dici ſive laius fuerit cum muliere ſive non fuerit copulata enim re eſt confatalis ſic enim appellat qui ita fatum ſit concubiturum cum uxore laium ex eo oedipum procreaturum illuſtrateth abſurdity deduction another manner thus ut ſi eſſet dictum luctabitur olympiis milo referret aliquis ergo ſive habuerit adverſarium ſive non habuerit luctabitur erraret eſt enim copulatum luctabitur quia ſine adverſario nulla luctatio eſt concludes kind captious argumentation admit ſame ſolution omnes igitur iſtius generis captiones eodem modo refelluntur sive tu medicum adhibueris ſive non adhibueris captioſum tam enim fatale eſt medicum adhibere quam convaleſcere haec ut dixi confatalia ille appellat manner ſolution ſo ſufficient carneades diſdained preſſe stoicks kind argumentation though oppoſite enough opinion forthwith cicero expreſſeth carneades hoc totum genus non probabat minùs inconſiderate concludi hanc rationem putabat ita que premebat alio modo nec ullam adhibebat calumniam condemned calumnious argumentation againſt stoicks though himſelfe ſore adverſary therefore chriſtians doe reaſon thus either heart countenance prophane courſes juſtify ſuch reaſoning thereby oppoſe god free grace election unreaſonableneſſe thereof thus ſet forth acknowledged ſides light nature let take heed feare leaſt heathen men riſe judgement againſt tiberius opinion argumentation eaſy matter devill perſwade arminian reprobate yet vanity argumentation formerly ſhewed repreſenting firſt vaſt number heathen age compariſon unto chriſtians secondly variety sect chriſtian religion moſt miſerably corrupt together vaſt number prophane perſons ſide hypocrite ſhould man privy owne heart looking towards heaven carried away ſo baſe pretence conceive himſelfe reprobate eſpecially conſidering nature man hope beſt fortune upon ground ſpeake appeares thoſe venture lottery whereas every true chriſtian believing chriſt hath certaine ground aſſurance election doctrine truly verily perſwaded devill wiſe think ſo baſe illuſion likely prevaile save caſe author informator doe believe pretend hereupon may take advantage work upon according rule perſwade thereby reprobate till find hath prevailed ſo reaſon conceive eaſy matter perſwade u abſolute reprobate neither conſidering make ſuch rule rather conceive fancy crackt crazed braines devill need wiſe ſo practice prevaile u undoubtedly ſo long god pleaſed grace keepe u right wit never ſhall certainly deſire bring rule faith muſt firſt manifeſt devill hath ſo prevailed make conceive themſelues concerning abſoluteneſſe making veſſell wrath firſt muſt diſpatch anſwer antegredients thoſe two part let remembred formerly delivered ſtill confounds reprobation grace reprobation glory maintained abſoluteneſſe one well maintain abſoluteneſſe moſt untrue albeit maintaine god hath decreed abſolutely beſtow grace upon ſome god elect abſolutely deny grace unto others account reprobate upon conditionally grace ordayned beſtowed conditionally wit upon condition ſome worke performed man ſhould grace beſtowed according unto workes phraſe ancient one ſaying grace beſtowed according unto merit condemned 1200 yeares agoe synod paleſtine pelagius driven ſubſcribe unto leſt otherwiſe himſelfe bin excommunicated doe maintain god hath ordayned damnation ſhall abſolutely inflicted conditionally wit caſe dye ſin yet became author wiſdom confound leaſt diſtinguiſhing ought diſtinguiſhed carrying himſelfe fairly oppoſing abſolutenes reprobation alone alone maintained adverſaries wit particular reprobation grace ſhould firſt daſh manifeſt himſelfe maintain grace beſtowed according good pleaſure god according workes men upon ground buildeth comfortable condition doctrine crucifixum quantum ſi fuiſset pro domino crucifixus tunc enim fides ejus de ligno floruit quando diſcipulorum marcuit niſi cujus mortis terrore marcuerunt ejus reſurrectione revireſceret illi enim conſcience overtooke hereupon notorious iſſue whereof end woefull dayes woefully deſpaire nothing ſtrange diſcourſes meditation midſt deſperate condition particular following 1 touching greatneſſe ſinne taken example peter find ſuch thing neither sleidan oſiander goulartius rather latter make largeſt relation thereof taken diſcourſe one henry scringer learned lawyer padua ſee many time talke still wee muſt remember magnificently author go confound thing differ whereas maintaine god hath decreed proceed abſolutely men giving denying grace abſolutely giving ſalvation inflicting damnation author though ſo carrieth matter along maintained god proceeding abſolute herein wit granting ſalvation ſome inflicting damnation upon others yet hath meanes help himſelfe herein caſt ſhew true even repent god ready worke repent caſe man repent need hath divine aſſiſtance cauſe repent ſeeing hath already laſtly doth god give man power refuſe believe refuſe repent ready concurre ſinfull act worke alſo caſe theſe gift god well others conclude think gift faith hath chriſt merited u ſeemes doctrine hath teach albeit chriſt hath ſatisfied merited everlaſting life yet benefit chriſt obedience death ordinance god applyable none ſuch faith wherby appears make faith thoſe benefit redound unto u obedience chriſt though decent ſay ſalvation benefit procured chriſts obedience redound none ſuch cenſurae p 56 dealing ingenuouſly confeſſing whereunto genius tenet doth carry arminian deale ſo plainly pretend faith repentance gift god ſo pretend chriſt merited u wit merited univerſall grace effect due time remigius manifeſted theſe word pag 155 ſame booke non praedeſtinat niſi quae fuerat ipſe facturus quae uti que omnia bona juſta ſunt auſtine like manner de bono perſeverantiae cap 17 ſua quae falli mutari que non poteſt praeſcientia opera ſua diſponere illud omnino nec aliud quicquid eſt praedeſtinare ſo synod valens 3 praedeſtinatione autem deum ea tantum ſtatuiſſe dicimus quae ipſe vel gratuitâ miſericoràiâ vel juſlo judicio facturus erat mali verò ipſam malitiam praeſciſſe quia ab ipſis eſt non praedeſtinaſſe quia ab illo non eſt good reaſon becauſe malum non habet cauſam efficientem ſed deficientem auſtine writes de civit dei lib 12 cap 7 neceſſitie ſinning willingly profeſſe flow ſinne adam god alone cure man none ſame remigius acknowledgeth hiſtor gotteſca pag 3 anima humana voluntas humana ſicut verè manet morte non diligendo ita verè transfertur de morte vitam diligendo tranſlation wrought followes hac dilectione non fit verè liberū arbitrium id eſt verè libera voluntas niſi illo liberante id eſt libertatem largiente qui ait ſi vos filius liberaverit tune verè liberi eritis niſi illo munere spiritus dei de quo dicit apoſtolus ubi autem spiritus domini ibi libertas love made free freeing ſaith sonne ſhall make free ſhall ye free indeed otherwiſe gift spirit god whereof apoſtle ſpeakes ſpirit lord liberty nay verily perſwaded hincmarus himſelfe againſt remigius diſputeth orthodox argument authour thus writes hincmarus ſeen ſame hiſtory gotteſcalchus pag 39 quoſdam maſſa peccati perditionis juſtè deſeruit à qua praedeſtinatione ſua id eſt gratiae praeparatione occulto ſed non injuſto judicio nequaquam eripuit men god juſtly deſerted maſſe ſinne perdition predeſtination preparation grace never delivered judgment ſecret unjuſt whereas authour men delivered maſſe ſinne perdition certaine univerſall grace beſtowed upon whereby put kind indifferent eſtate believe believe repent repent hincmarus never acknowledged yet neceſſitie ſinning incident brought forth world maſſa peccati perditionis maſſe originall ſinne perdition ſuch either opinion whereby cannot ſinne although would abſtaine though obtruded upon u upon remigius whereupon pleades himſelfe ſuch mind doctrine predeſtination manner pag 53 nemo ſentit aut dicit quod dei praedeſtinatio aliquem invitum faciat peccare ut jam non propriae voluntatis perverſitate ſed divinae praedeſtinationis neceſſitate peccare videatur man ſaith doth ſo think ſpeak god predeſtination made man ſinne againſt ſuch ſort ſhould ſeeme ſinne perverſneſſe owne neceſſity divine predeſtination ſo ſay neither impotency good elſe corruption morall impotency according saint auſtine libertas ſine gratia non eſt libertas ſed contumacia libertie without grace libertie wilfullneſſe remigius hiſtor gotteſcal pag 29 exquibus ſaith ſpeaking reprobate nemo poteſt ſalvari non propter violentiam aliquam divinae poteſtatis ſed propter indomabilem perſeverantem nequitiam ſuae iniquitatis one ſaved becauſe violence divine power reaſon untameable perſevering naughtines owne iniquity p 144 de reprobis nullum ſalvari ullatenus exiſtimavi non quia non poſſunt homines de bono ad malū commutari de mali ac pravis boni ac rectus fieri ſed quia meliùs mutare noluerunt peſſimis operibus uſ que ad fiaē perſeverare voluerunt reprobate doe judge ſaved becauſe could changed evill good evill depraved become good right becauſe would chāged better would end perſevere wicked workes could changed would reſpect ſaid could changed reſpect freedome will without grace nothing leſſe ſee owne word pag 34 si dixiſſet generaliter nemo hominum ſine dei gratia libero benè uti poteſt arbitrio eſſet catholicus ſaid generally man rightly uſe free without grace god catholique queſtion manner grace doth worke wit whether god give men grace believe repent leaf performe act faith repentance whether god worketh act faith repentance diſpute point god word clearely teacheth god workes u deed according good pleaſure philip 3 13 make u perfect every good worke working u pleaſing ſight ieſus chriſt let u take notice diſcourſe hincmarus remigius argument heb 13 20 till love god come man dead dead good love given believer poſſe charitatem habere naturae eſt hominum charitatem autem habere gratiae eſt fidelium de praedeſtinatione ſanctorum cap 5 thus writes hincmarus pag 3 113 bonum quod agimus dei eſt noſtrum dei per praevenientem gratiam noſtrum per ſubſequentē liberam voluntatem good doe god worke god grace preventing free following remigius anſwers firſt ſaith hincmarus diſcoureſeth ſuch manner good worke partly god worke partly againe beginning good worke god effect thereof man free although hincmarus doth endeavour temper ſpeech addition grace fulneſſe gratiae adjunctione non etiam plen • tudine adjunction grace alſo fulneſſe ſhould done ſaith remigius cum verè totum ſit dei ſeeing indeed whole god worke truth ſelfe ſaith without ye nothing apoſtle haſt thou thou haſt received whence bleſſed glorious martyr cyprian hath ſo defined ſaying muſt glory nothing ſeeing nothing concludes thus bonum ita que noſtrum totum dei eſt quia totum eſt ex deo nihil boni noſtri noſtrum eſt quia nihil boni noſtri eſt ex nobis therefore good workes holy god noe good becauſe u reconcile ſeeming contradiction calling good yet denying u concludes thus omne bonum noſtrum totum dei eſt donando totum noſtrum eſt accipiendo every good thing wholy god much give becomes full whole much receive fulgentius plaine lib 1 ad monium pag 6 theſe whome god foreſaw would terrified confeſſing god foreknowledge man ſhould diſcourſe thereof manner people whether ye live well well ſuch ſhall ye hereafter god foreſees ye either good foreſees ye good evill foreſees evill auſtine able anſwere himſelfe whileſt living let u conſider proſper anſwers dead firſt let u conſider objection ſelfe predeſtinate unto life although live piouſly righteouſly ſhall nothing profit non poteſt free ſo damned loſt adam may free dead workes living workes cannot yet pag 174 thus diſtinguiſheth anſwerably paſſage alleaged authour de reprobis nullum ſalvari ullatenus exiſtimamus non quia non poſſunt homines de malo ad bonum commutari ac de mali ac pravis boni ac rectus fieri ſed quia melius mutari noluerunt peſſimis operibus uſ que ad finem perſeverare voluerunt pag 143 florus church lyon remigius byſhop ſets downe ſame truth large thus habet homo poſt illam damnationem liberum arbitrium quo voluntate propria inclinari poteſt inclinatur ad malum habet liberum arbitrium quo poteſt aſſurgere ad bonum ut autem aſſurgat ad bonum non eſt propriae virtutis ſed gratiae dei miſerantis nam qui mortuus eſt poteſt dici poſſe vivere non tamen ſua virtute ſed dei ita liberum arbitrium hominis ſemel ſauciatum ſemel mortuum poteſt ſanari non tamen ſua virtute ſed gratia miſerantis dei ideo omnes homines admonentur omnibus verbum praedicatur quia habent poſſe credere poſſe converti ad deum ut verbo extrinſecus admonente intus deo ſuſcitante qui audiunt reviviſcant man hath damnation wit ſuch followed adam fall free ſo owne inclined inclined evill hath free whereby may riſe unto good condition doth ariſe good condition owne power grace god compaſſionating alſo dead may ſaid may live yet owne power power god soe man free alſo wounded dead may reſtored owne power god grace pitying therefore al men admoniſhed word preached becauſe may believe may converted unto god word outwardly admoniſhing god inwardly raiſing heare may revive touching laſt condemning thoſe ſay ſhould ſo predeſtinated evill god cannot otherwiſe authour would faine inſinuate reader opinion wicked men may change evill good themſelves neither doth councill valens remigius chiefe man therein amongſt thoſe grave judicious perſons thou wilt never doe becauſe fowle diſhoneſt opinion true religion vives ſaith thing guilded gold ſelfe ſcraped diſcovered brighter goodlier ſo truth vives de one conſent profeſſe synod granted remonſtrants much libertie defence cauſe equitie could granted could well ſtand honour synod therefore cauſe decree synod ſhould altered remonſtrants ſhould complaine decline authority synod nothing put upon burthen ſome conſciences therefore vaine pretend ſcruples conſcience seſſion 42 repreſentation made unreaſonable demaund namely firſt place deale upon reprobation c whereupon opinion forrain divine required whether fit yeild unto treat reprobation treated election declared concurring ſuffrages courſe propoſed moſt unreaſonable let reader judge unſhamefaſt crimination author chargeth synod conſequently forreine divine therein aſſembled juſtified thoſe synodicall proceeding unanimous conſent surely author hath high opinion himſelfe owne ſufficiencies thinkes bolt ſoone ſhot worth concurrent verdict thoſe divine choſen eminent perſons ſeverall church ſentunto sinod many place chriſtendome hee progreſſe unſhamefaſt diſcourſe ſpares reward inflict eternall death way puniſhment yet conferring grace regeneration faith repentance upon one denying ſame grace unto lord carrieth himſelfe according men workes merely according pleaſure
